p: In a general way, β-myrcene was present in all analyzed accessions of L. alba, except in X6MIA. β-myrcene is a colorless or light-yellow oily monoterpene with an important industrial value. Due to its pleasant smell with a woody, spicy, peach, sweet, vanilla, and wine-like odor description, this compound is a value intermediate for the preparation of flavor and fragrance chemicals. Furthermore, myrcene is also described as a versatile starting material for vitamins and pharmaceuticals due to its reactive diene structure [ 36, 37, 38, 39], and as having significant pharmacological properties, such as anti-inflammatory and anti-catabolic effects for deceleration of osteoarthritis progression [ 40], and as an activator for TRPV1 as target for treating pain [ 41].
